chunks.original_text: 哀哀念子苦，懃懃令我忧。 次唱，静念如法。 各放手简，着几案上，平坐接手，叩齿三十六通，冥目存思五色云气覆满一室，青龙、白虎、狮子、玄龟、朱雀、凤凰备守前后，仙童玉女、五帝灵官、神仙兵马、九亿万众营卫左右，便摇身三过，祝曰：寂寂至无宗，虚峙劫刃阿。 豁落洞玄文，谁测此幽遐。 一入大乘路，孰计年劫多。 不生亦不死，欲生因莲华。 超凌三界涂，慈心解世罗。 真人无上德，世世为仙家。 次唱一切诵，各念无上尊七遍讫，唱请转法轮，乃一时开经。 若别推一人，上座诵经，便唱请法师升高座。 法师起，执简当经像三礼，从南西北向上座，左转东向叩齿，有思如法。 下座，还从南面下，三拜。 此洞玄法。 余洞真、洞神，各依本法。 若修行经法者，复各案本科，今不复具。 读经竟，收经一人，行水洒净，复持香旋行。 敛净总讫，赞咏如法，唱人各恭敬，三上香，执简平立，至心归命太上三尊、十方众圣。 高德一人叹经启愿，详夫三洞宝经，万天胜范，结飞玄之气，成云篆之章，义冠元生，文垂永劫。 故天地持之以分判，日月因之以运行，鬼神敬之以变通，人民奉之以开度。 是以咏之者，则形陟绛霄； 闻之者，乃神生碧落。 莫不人天仰赖，生死依凭，为群品之津梁，皇众真之户牖。 不可得而言者，其大乘之蕴乎。 甲等今为某事，转某经若干卷若干遍尔。 其开函演奥，则响彻三千； 执卷吟玄，乃声闻五亿。 当愿侍香金媛，结香字於天中； 典经玉郎； 进经文於简上。 即使愆消昔劫，福降今辰，存亡喜开泰之恩，动植悦生成之德。 以兹胜善，遍采装严，三涂罢楚毒之劳，九夜绝辛酸之苦，暨乎悠悠庶品，蠢蠢群生，俱乘六度之舟，并上三清之岸。 愿转经已后，万善扶持，千灾荡减，至心稽首正真三宝。 愿转经已后，福被幽明，功沾远近，至心稽首正真三宝。 愿以此转经功德，资被群生，离苦解脱，至心稽首一切众圣。 若常修经法，当旋行诵太极经赞七首、灵书四天王颂四首，及真文八景赞、上经歌颂，今不复具。 科曰：凡读诵经，依此仪。 违，夺算二千四百。 讲经仪 法师盥漱，冠带如法。 弟子持香花，拜请导引，一如科说。 法师登经像前席，端立执香炉当心讫，唱人各恭敬，归依大道。 当愿众生解悟正真，发无上心，归依经法。 当愿众生智慧洞开，深广如海，归依玄师。 当愿众生辨幽释滞，并弘正道。 法师登阁道平立，唱平坐如法。 待法师三上香竟，复唱静念如法。 又存念讫，唱赞咏如法。 咒曰：寂寂至无宗，虚峙劫刃阿。 豁落洞玄文，谁测此幽遐。 一入大乘路，孰计年劫多。 不生亦不死，欲生因莲华。 超凌三界涂，慈心解世罗。 真人无上德，世世为仙家。 次唱请转法轮，复唱一切诵，普诵无上尊七遍。 都讲便叙经唱经，法师皆约敕座下，礼经一拜。 按文解释罢，讲作安和，乐未央声。 每讲罢，法师执香炉捻香，愿以此讲经功德，庄严皇帝太子、诸王公侯牧伯、州县令长、天下人民、讲经信士、见在法徒、一切众生、三涂苦辈，藉此善根，悉得体解大乘，归心正道，咸出爱河，俱游法海。 更唱人各恭敬，至心归命太上三尊、十方众圣。 愿皇帝百福庄严，万善云集，至心稽首正真三宝。
chunks.translated_text:
With sorrow I lament your suffering, with diligence I bear my sorrow.

Next, chant and meditate in stillness as prescribed. Each shall lay down their tablet upon the desk, sit upright with hands clasped, and strike the teeth thirty-six times. With eyes closed, visualize five-colored clouds of qi filling the chamber, with the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Lion, Dark Tortoise, Vermilion Bird, and Phoenix guarding front and rear. Divine youths and jade maidens, the Five Thearchs’ spirit officials, immortals’ troops and cavalry—nine hundred million in number—encamp and defend on all sides. Then shake the body thrice and invoke:

*"Silent, it reaches the Primordial Source,*
*Void, it towers beyond kalpas’ blade.*
*Profound, the Huoluo’s Mystic Writ—*
*Who fathoms such depths of seclusion?*
*Once on the Great Vehicle’s path,*
*Who reckons the kalpas’ span?*
*Neither born nor dying,*
*Yet born through the lotus.*
*Transcending the Three Realms’ roads,*
*With compassion, the world’s snares unravel.*
*The Perfected, of supreme virtue,*
*Life after life, dwell as immortals."*

Next, chant the "All Recite" and invoke the Supreme Venerable One seven times. Then chant the request to turn the Wheel of Dharma, and all shall open the scriptures together. If another is designated to ascend the high seat and recite, chant the invitation for the Dharma Master to ascend. The Dharma Master rises, holds the tablet, and bows thrice before the scripture and image. Facing south, west, and north toward the high seat, then turning left to face east, they strike the teeth and meditate as prescribed. Descending the seat, they bow thrice from the south. Such is the *Dongxuan* Dharma. For *Dongzhen* and *Dongshen*, follow their respective rites. Those who practice scripture rituals shall adhere to their own regulations; these are not repeated here.

When the scripture reading concludes, one person collects the scriptures, sprinkles purifying water, and circumambulates with incense. Once purification is complete, chant the hymn of praise as prescribed. All chant with reverence, offer incense thrice, hold their tablets upright, and with utmost sincerity, surrender themselves to the Supreme Three Honored Ones and the saints of the ten directions. A senior adept shall extol the scriptures and make vows, declaring:

*"The Three Caverns’ precious scriptures, the myriad heavens’ sublime models, condense the qi of soaring mystery and form the chapters of cloud-seal script. Their meaning crowns primordial arising, their text endures through eternal kalpas. Thus, heaven and earth rely on them for division and judgment; sun and moon depend on them for movement and revolution. Ghosts and spirits revere them for transformation and penetration; the people uphold them for liberation and deliverance. Those who chant them ascend to the crimson empyrean; those who hear them are reborn in the azure vault. None—whether human or celestial—do not look up to them in reliance, nor—whether living or dead—do not depend on them for refuge. They are the bridge for all beings, the gateway for the host of perfected immortals. What cannot be spoken of in words is the treasury of the Great Vehicle.*

*Today, for such-and-such a purpose, we turn such-and-such a scripture, so many scrolls, so many times. As the case is opened and its mysteries expounded, the resonance reaches the Three Thousand Worlds; as the scroll is held and its profundities intoned, the sound is heard by five hundred million. May the golden maidens attending incense inscribe fragrant characters in the heavens; may the jade lads overseeing scriptures present the sacred text upon the tablets. Thus, past transgressions from former kalpas shall dissolve, and blessings descend upon this very day. The living and the dead shall rejoice in the grace of peace and prosperity; all beings, moving and still, shall delight in the virtue of growth and fulfillment. Through this supreme goodness, may all adornments be perfected. May the Three Paths cease their torments, and the Nine Nights end their bitterness and sorrow. May all beings, from the most refined to the most humble, together board the boat of the Six Perfections and ascend the shore of the Three Clarities.*

*After the turning of the scriptures, may ten thousand virtues uphold us, and a thousand disasters be dispelled. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures. After the turning of the scriptures, may blessings extend to the hidden and the manifest, and merit reach the distant and the near. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures. May the merit of this turning of the scriptures extend to all beings, freeing them from suffering and granting liberation. With utmost sincerity, we bow to all the saints."*

For regular scripture practice, circumambulate while reciting the *Taiyi Scripture Hymns* (seven verses), the *Four Heavenly Kings’ Eulogies from the Numinous Writ* (four verses), the *Eight Radiant Eulogies of the True Writ*, and the *Hymns of the Supreme Scripture*; these are not repeated here.

The regulations state: For all scripture recitation, follow this rite. Violations deduct 2,400 days from one’s lifespan.

**Lecture Rite for Scriptures**
The Dharma Master washes and rinses, dons robes and sash as prescribed. Disciples hold incense and flowers, bow, and request guidance, all according to the regulations. The Dharma Master ascends to the seat before the scripture and image, stands upright holding the incense burner before the heart, then chants for all to show reverence and take refuge in the Great Dao.

*"May all beings awaken to the True and Real, arouse the supreme mind, and take refuge in the scriptures and Dharma.*
*May all beings’ wisdom open wide, vast as the sea, and take refuge in the Mystic Master.*
*May all beings discern the obscure and resolve obstructions, all propagating the True Dao."*

The Dharma Master ascends the platform and stands upright. Chant for all to sit properly as prescribed. After the Dharma Master offers incense thrice, chant again for still meditation as prescribed. Once visualization is complete, chant the hymn of praise as prescribed. The incantation reads:

*"Silent, it reaches the Primordial Source,*
*Void, it towers beyond kalpas’ blade.*
*Profound, the Huoluo’s Mystic Writ—*
*Who fathoms such depths of seclusion?*
*Once on the Great Vehicle’s path,*
*Who reckons the kalpas’ span?*
*Neither born nor dying,*
*Yet born through the lotus.*
*Transcending the Three Realms’ roads,*
*With compassion, the world’s snares unravel.*
*The Perfected, of supreme virtue,*
*Life after life, dwell as immortals."*

Next, chant the request to turn the Wheel of Dharma, then chant the "All Recite" and universally invoke the Supreme Venerable One seven times. The chief cantor then introduces the scripture and chants its title, while the Dharma Master instructs the assembly and bows once to the scripture. After explaining the text, the lecture concludes with harmonious music and the refrain *"Le Wei Yang."*

After each lecture, the Dharma Master holds the incense burner and offers incense, vowing:

*"May the merit of this lecture adorn the Emperor, the Crown Prince, the princes, dukes, governors, and local officials; the people of the realm; the faithful who attend the lecture; the present assembly of disciples; all beings; and those suffering in the Three Paths. Through this root of goodness, may all awaken to the Great Vehicle, turn their hearts to the True Dao, escape the river of desire, and together sail the sea of Dharma."*

Again, chant for all to show reverence and with utmost sincerity surrender themselves to the Supreme Three Honored Ones and the saints of the ten directions.

*"May the Emperor be adorned with a hundred blessings, may ten thousand virtues gather like clouds. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures."*

**Regulation states:** All sutra lectures shall follow this procedure. Violations shall incur a deduction of 1,200 days from one’s allotted lifespan.

---

**Dharma Ritual Protocol**

**Regulation states:** Daoist priests and priestesses hold ranks, titles, and hierarchical positions. One must recognize distinctions of seniority and precedence; no overstepping is permitted. Below is the full enumeration—study it carefully. Violations shall incur a deduction of 1,200 days from one’s allotted lifespan.

**Regulation states:** Terms such as *Daoist layfolk*, *worthy ones*, *devotees*, *good men*, *good women*, and *practitioners* are honorifics for those who precede Daoist priests and priestesses in virtue; they are not legal designations for petitions or complaints. Likewise, titles such as *Dharma Master*, *Great Virtue*, *Venerable Master*, and *Superior One* are honorifics for male renunciates of external lineages and are not suitable for memorials or formal requests. Furthermore, *this humble Daoist* is a self-deprecating term for renunciates, while *disciple* is a humble term for the laity—neither is to be used before the Three Treasures. These differ from the titles *Disciple of the Three Caverns* and *Dharma Master*; study them carefully. Below is the full enumeration:

- *Men* and *women* refer to ordinary people who have not yet received scriptures or precepts.
- *Household head* refers to those registered in the Daoist household records who offer sincerity to the Dao.
- *Disciples of the Great Dao*, *Disciples of the Heavenly Worthy*, *Disciples of the Three Treasures*, *those who turn their hearts to the Great Dao*, and *those who diligently study the scriptural teachings* may bear these titles.
- *Pure and Faithful Disciples* who receive the Heavenly Worthy’s Ten Precepts, Fourteen Rules of Conduct, or the Twelve Precepts of Compliance, Six Emotions, and the like may bear this title.
- *Male Initiates* and *Female Initiates*, at ages seven or eight, who receive the Register of One General may bear this title.
- *Register Initiates*, at age ten or above, who receive the Registers of Three Generals or Ten Generals, as well as the Three Refuges and Five Precepts, may bear this title.

**Regulation states:** For all ten titles, when making petitions or memorials before the Heavenly Worthy and the Great Dao, one must refer to oneself as *so-and-so* (某甲) and not use the title directly. Violations shall incur a deduction of 360 days from one’s allotted lifespan.

One is titled *Tai Shang Middle Qi of Yangping Treatise, Leading the Twenty-Four Vital Qi, Practicing Zhengyi Alliance-Wei and Yuanming Perfected*.

chunks.original_text: 受，称洞真法师。 洞玄灵宝三洞奉道科戒营始卷之四竟 洞玄灵宝三洞奉道科戒营始卷之五 上清大洞真经目 《上清大洞真经三十九章》一卷、《上清太上隐书金真玉光》一卷、《上清八素真经服日月皇华》一卷、《上清飞步天刚蹑行七元》一卷、《上清九真中经黄老秘言》一卷、《上清上经变化七十四方》一卷、《上清除六天文三天正法》一卷、《上清黄气阳精三道顺行》一卷、《上清外国放品青童内文》二卷、《上清金阙上记灵书紫文》一卷、《上清紫度炎光神玄变经》一卷、《上清青要紫书金根上经》一卷、《上清玉精真诀三九素语》一卷、《上清三元玉检三元布经》一卷、《上清石精金光藏景录形》一卷、《上清丹景道精隐地八术》上下二卷、《上清神州七转七变舞天经》一卷、《上清大有八素大丹隐书》一卷、《上清天关三图七星移度》一卷、《上清九丹上化胎精中记》一卷、《上清太上六甲九赤班符》一卷、《上清神虎上符消魔智慧》一卷、《上清曲素诀词五行秘符》一卷、《上清白羽黑翮飞行羽经》一卷、《上清素奏丹符灵飞六甲》一卷、《上清玉佩金珰太极金书》一卷、《上清九灵太妙龟山元录》三卷、《上清七圣玄纪徊天九霄》一卷、《上清太上黄素四十四方》一卷、《上清太霄琅书琼文帝章》一卷。 些三十四卷玉清、紫清、太清大洞经限，是王君授南真。 《上清高上灭魔洞景金玄玉清隐书》四卷、《上清太微天帝君金虎真符》一卷、《上清太微天帝君神虎玉经真符》一卷、《上清太上黄庭内景玉经太帝内书》一卷。 右七卷，紫虚元、君南岳上真魏夫人在世受经限。 《上清三元斋仪》二卷、《上清传授仪》一卷、《上清告盟仪》一卷、《上清朝仪》一卷、《上清投简文》一卷、《登真隐诀》二十五卷、《真诰》十卷、《八真七传》七卷、《洞真观身三百大戒文》一卷。 右受，称无上洞真法师。 上清经，总一百五十卷。 上清太素交带，上清玄都交带，上清白纹交带，上清紫纹交带，一曰回车交带，亦谓毕道券，又名元始大券。 右受，称上清玄都大洞三景弟子、无上三洞法师。 科曰：道士、女冠，参受经戒法箓，须依此次第名位，不得叨谬。 受法之日，师宜详审分明，示其品目。 违，夺算三千六百。 科曰：道士、女冠受经戒已，皆当诵其戒文，使精熟。 每至月一日、十五日、三十日，总集法堂，递相简阅。 三犯不通，罚香五斤； 违，夺算一千二百。 科曰：道士、女冠所受经戒法箓，皆依目抄写，装褙入藏，置经堂、静室或阁，如法具龙璧幡花真文，朝夕供养礼忏。 不得轻慢泄秽，传付他人，常当诵念转读。 若身之后，门人、同学校录供养，不得泄慢。 其正一符箓、及诸券契函盛，随亡师所在山谷，或墓内，别作坎安置，余皆不得辄随身去。 所以者，真经宝重，灵官侍奉，尸朽之秽，宁可近之，此最至慎。 违，魂谪三官，殃及七世子孙，各明慎之。 科曰：道士、女冠，总兼前法、备修行者，启奏之曰：称上清玄都大洞三景弟子，奉行灵宝自然升玄法师、某狱某帝真人、三皇洞神洞渊神咒大古否二昧小兆真人，臣某上启，或再拜。 若正一法备，称太玄都正一平气，系天师阳平治太上中气，领二十四生气，督察二十四治三五大都功，正一盟威元命真人，臣甲再拜上言。

**Ordinance states:** Daoists and female Daoist adepts, when receiving scriptures, precepts, and registers, must adhere to this sequential hierarchy of titles and ranks; no presumption or error is permitted. On the day of transmission, the master shall carefully and clearly instruct the recipient in the grades and categories. Violation results in the deduction of 3,600 years from one’s allotted lifespan.

**Ordinance states:** Daoists and female Daoist adepts, after receiving scriptures and precepts, must recite their precept texts to achieve thorough familiarity. On the first, fifteenth, and thirtieth days of each month, all shall assemble in the Dharma hall to mutually examine and review. Three failures to recite result in a penalty of five *jin* of incense; violation incurs the deduction of 1,200 years from one’s allotted lifespan.

**Ordinance states:** Daoists and female Daoist adepts shall copy all received scriptures, precepts, and registers according to their catalogues, bind them, and store them in the scripture hall, quiet chamber, or pavilion. They shall properly arrange dragon jades, banners, flowers, and true writs, and make daily offerings with reverence and repentance. No carelessness, defilement, or transmission to others is permitted; constant recitation and reading are required. After one’s passing, disciples and fellow students shall continue the offerings and recitation, without negligence or disrespect. As for the *Orthodox Unity* talismans and all certificates in their cases, these shall be buried in a pit at the mountain valley or tomb where the deceased master resided; none may be taken away. This is because the true scriptures are of precious and numinous weight, attended by divine officials. How could the defilement of a rotting corpse be allowed near them? This matter demands the utmost caution. Violation results in the soul’s condemnation by the Three Bureaus, with calamity extending to seven generations of descendants. All must clearly heed this.

**Ordinance states:** Daoists and female Daoist adepts who cumulatively receive all preceding methods and fully cultivate their practice shall, when submitting petitions, declare: *"Disciple of the Three Luminaries of the Supreme Cavern of Mysterious Capital, practicing the Numinous Treasure’s Natural Ascent to the Mysterious, Master of the [specific] Prison, [specific] Thearch Perfected, and Three August Ones’ Cavern of Spirits and Cavern of Abysses’ Divine Incantations, Great Ancient Negation and Twofold Obscurity’s Minor Omen Perfected, your subject [Name] respectfully submits"*—or bow twice. If fully versed in the *Orthodox Unity* method, declare: *"Supreme Mysterious Capital’s Orthodox Unity and Balanced Qi, affiliated with the Celestial Master’s Yangping Abbey and Supreme Middle Qi, overseeing the twenty-four vital qi, supervising the twenty-four abbeys and three-five great metropolises’ merits, Orthodox Unity Alliance’s Primordial Mandate Perfected, your subject [Name] bows twice and respectfully addresses."*

chunks.original_text: 若叨僭此位，魂考三官，夺算总尽，慎之慎之。 法服图仪 科曰：服．以象德仪形。 道士、女冠，威仪之先，参佩经法，各须具备，一如本法，不得叨谬。 违，夺算三千六百。 正一法师：玄冠、黄裙、绛褐、绛帔，二十四条，列图如下。 高玄法师：玄冠、黄裙、黄褐、黄帔，二十八条，列图如下。 洞神法师：玄冠、黄裙、青褐、黄帔，三十二条，列图如下。 洞玄法师：芙蓉冠、黄褐、黄裙、紫帔，三十二条，列图如下。 洞真法师：元始冠、青裙、紫褐、紫被青裹，表二十四条，裹十五条，列图如下。 大洞法师：元始冠、黄裙、紫褐，如上清法，五色云霞帔，列图如下。 三洞讲法师：元始冠、黄褐、绛裙、九色离罗帔，列图如下。 科曰：道士、女冠，若不备此法衣，皆不得轻动宝经。 具其法服，皆有神童侍卫。 正一法衣，将军五人、力士八人侍卫。 高玄法服，神童、神女各二人侍卫。 洞神法衣，天男、天女各三人侍卫。 洞玄法衣，玉童、玉女各八人侍卫。 洞真大洞三洞法衣，玉童、玉女各十二人侍卫。 总谓之法服。 违，侍童远身，四司考魂，减算二千四百。 科曰：凡道士、女冠，欲参经法，皆预备法衣。 既告斋传法位讫一即须冠带法服，执简称名位，拜其本师，朝谒太上。 违，灵官不附身，魂考五帝，夺算一千二百。 科曰：女冠法服，衣褐，并同道士，唯冠异制。 法用玄纱，前后左右皆三叶，不安远游。 若上清大洞女冠，冠飞云凤气之冠，今列图如下。 山居法师法服：二仪冠、上下黄裙，帔三十六条，列图如下。 凡常道士法服：平冠、上下黄裙，帔二十四条，列图如下。 凡常女冠法服：玄冠、上下黄裙，帔十八条，列图如下。 科曰：凡道士、女冠履屦，或用草，或以木，或纯漆。 布帛拖绢，漫饰衣帔，皆二仪，或山像，内外朴素，不得彩饰华绮。 违，夺算一千四百。 科曰：凡履，下皆有龙虎神伏，夜安版箦床几上，不得正尔顿地，及履厕涵。 违，夺算八百二十。 科曰：簪用牙角、竹玉，任依时制，皆不得雕镂为异形像。 违，夺算八百二十。 科曰：道士、女冠法衣，皆不得冒犯秽恶，假借他人，须箱箧藏揲，冠履亦然。 违，夺算一千二百。 洞玄灵宝三洞奉道科戒营始卷之五竟 洞玄灵宝三洞奉道科戒营始卷之六 常朝仪 四众三洞，可旦夕常行，所以谓之常朝。 若别入室朝真，自依五等朝法也。 洗漱如法。 初入堂，上香旋行，颂曰： 学道当勤苦，敛信运丹诚。 烧香归太上，真炁杂烟馨。 唯希开大宥，七祖离幽冥。 三上香，各依位，端身执简，礼十方，从东始。 上香讫，唱人各恭敬。 至心归命东方玉宝皇上天尊，至心归命南方玄真万福天尊，至心归命西方太妙至极天尊，至心归命北方玄上玉晨天尊，至心归命东北度仙上圣天尊，至心归命东南好生度命天尊，至心归命西南太灵虚皇天尊，至心归命西北无量太华天尊，至心归命上方玉虚明皇天尊，至心归命下方真皇洞神天尊。 各长跪执简，当心忏悔曰： 众等至心归身无极大道天尊，忏悔皇家、及臣众等一切众生，前代今身，或身形所犯，四肢举措，动违戒律，不依经典。 身业大罪，无量无边，因今礼忏，并乞荡除，皆愿众等，身入至仙，会道合真，稽首十方正真三宝。

If one presumptuously usurps this rank, the Three Offices shall examine the soul, and all life’s allotted spans shall be forfeit—beware, beware.

**Regulations on Ritual Attire and Demeanor**
The *Statutes* state: Attire mirrors virtue and embodies form.
Daoists and female Daoist adepts must first perfect their demeanor, wearing and bearing the scriptures and methods in full accordance with their respective traditions—no presumption or error is permitted.
Violation: 3,600 spans of life forfeit.

**Orthodox Unity (Zhengyi) Dharma Masters:**
- Black cap, yellow skirt, crimson robe, crimson stole with twenty-four strips (illustrated below).

**High Mystery (Gaoxuan) Dharma Masters:**
- Black cap, yellow skirt, yellow robe, yellow stole with twenty-eight strips (illustrated below).

**Cavern of Spirits (Dongshen) Dharma Masters:**
- Black cap, yellow skirt, azure robe, yellow stole with thirty-two strips (illustrated below).

**Cavern of Mystery (Dongxuan) Dharma Masters:**
- Hibiscus crown, yellow robe, yellow skirt, purple stole with thirty-two strips (illustrated below).

**Cavern of Perfection (Dongzhen) Dharma Masters:**
- Primordial Beginning crown, azure skirt, purple robe, purple outer garment wrapped in azure, with twenty-four strips on the outer layer and fifteen on the inner (illustrated below).

**Great Cavern (Dadong) Dharma Masters:**
- Primordial Beginning crown, yellow skirt, purple robe, following the Highest Clarity method, with a five-colored cloud-and-mist stole (illustrated below).

**Three Caverns’ Dharma Lecturers:**
- Primordial Beginning crown, yellow robe, crimson skirt, nine-colored *li-luo* stole (illustrated below).

The *Statutes* state: Daoists and female Daoist adepts who do not don these ritual vestments may not lightly handle the sacred scriptures.
When properly attired in ritual garb, divine youths stand in attendance:
- **Orthodox Unity vestments:** Five generals and eight divine warriors in attendance.
- **High Mystery vestments:** Two divine youths and two divine maidens in attendance.
- **Cavern of Spirits vestments:** Three celestial youths and three celestial maidens in attendance.
- **Cavern of Mystery vestments:** Eight jade youths and eight jade maidens in attendance.
- **Cavern of Perfection, Great Cavern, and Three Caverns vestments:** Twelve jade youths and twelve jade maidens in attendance.
Collectively termed *ritual vestments*.
Violation: Attendant youths withdraw, the Four Offices examine the soul, and 2,400 spans of life are forfeit.

The *Statutes* state: All Daoists and female Daoist adepts intending to engage with scriptures and methods must prepare their ritual vestments in advance.
Upon completing the announcement of the fast and transmission of the dharma rank, they must don the proper cap and vestments, hold the ritual tablet, declare their name and rank, bow to their master, and pay homage to the Most High.
Violation: Divine officials do not attend the body, the Five Thearchs examine the soul, and 1,200 spans of life are forfeit.

The *Statutes* state: Female Daoist adepts’ vestments—robes and skirts—are identical to those of Daoists, except for the cap, which differs in design.
The cap is made of black gauze, with three leaves each at the front, back, and sides, and no *yuan-you* ornament.
For Highest Clarity and Great Cavern female adepts, the cap is the *Flying Cloud Phoenix Qi* crown (illustrated below).

**Mountain-Dwelling Dharma Masters’ Vestments:**
- Two Principles cap, upper and lower yellow skirts, stole with thirty-six strips (illustrated below).

**Ordinary Daoists’ Vestments:**
- Plain cap, upper and lower yellow skirts, stole with twenty-four strips (illustrated below).

**Ordinary Female Daoist Adepts’ Vestments:**
- Black cap, upper and lower yellow skirts, stole with eighteen strips (illustrated below).

The *Statutes* state: Daoists and female Daoist adepts’ footwear may be made of grass, wood, or pure lacquer.
Cloth and silk trailing ribbons, as well as decorative patterns on robes and stoles, should reflect the Two Principles or mountain imagery, maintaining inner and outer simplicity—no colorful or ornate embellishments are permitted.
Violation: 1,400 spans of life forfeit.

The *Statutes* state: All footwear bears the crouching spirits of dragons and tigers. At night, they must be placed on a wooden bed or table and not left directly on the ground or worn in latrines or sewers.
Violation: 820 spans of life forfeit.

The *Statutes* state: Hairpins may be made of ivory, horn, bamboo, or jade, following contemporary styles, but must not be carved into unusual or figurative shapes.
Violation: 820 spans of life forfeit.

The *Statutes* state: Daoists and female Daoist adepts’ ritual vestments must not be defiled by impurity or lent to others. They must be stored in chests and boxes, and the same applies to caps and footwear.
Violation: 1,200 spans of life forfeit.

---
**Scripture of the Cavern of Mystery, Numinous Treasure, and Three Caverns’ Observances of Daoist Precepts and Rites, Scroll Five (End)**
**Scripture of the Cavern of Mystery, Numinous Treasure, and Three Caverns’ Observances of Daoist Precepts and Rites, Scroll Six**

**Rite of Daily Audience**
The Four Assemblies of the Three Caverns may perform this daily, morning and evening—hence it is called the *Daily Audience*.
For separate chamber audiences with the Perfected, follow the five grades of audience rites.

**Purification Ritual**
Upon entering the hall, offer incense and circumambulate while reciting:
*"To study the Dao, one must toil diligently,
Gathering faith to refine sincerity.
Burning incense, we return to the Most High,
True qi mingles with fragrant smoke.
May great pardon be granted,
That the seven ancestors depart the dark realms."*

Offer incense three times, then take positions, compose the body, hold the ritual tablet, and pay homage to the ten directions, beginning with the east.
After offering incense, the assembly sings in unison: *"Each reverently respectful."*

With utmost sincerity, prostrate and invoke:
*"To the Jade Treasure August Heavenly Worthy of the East, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Mysterious Perfected Heavenly Worthy of Myriad Blessings of the South, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Supreme Wondrous Utmost Heavenly Worthy of the West, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Mysterious Supreme Jade Dawn Heavenly Worthy of the North, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Ascending Immortal August Sage Heavenly Worthy of the Northeast, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Life-Nurturing Heavenly Worthy of the Southeast, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Supreme Numinous Void August Heavenly Worthy of the Southwest, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Boundless Supreme Florescence Heavenly Worthy of the Northwest, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Jade Clarity August Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Realm, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity.
To the Perfected August Heavenly Worthy of the Cavern Spirits of the Lower Realm, we prostrate and invoke with utmost sincerity."*

Each kneels lengthily, holding the tablet to the heart, and confesses:
*"We prostrate with utmost sincerity to the Boundless Great Dao Heavenly Worthy, confessing on behalf of the imperial house, all officials, and all beings. In past lives and the present, our bodies may have transgressed—our limbs’ movements and postures may have violated precepts or deviated from scriptures. The sins of bodily karma are measureless and boundless. Through this rite of repentance, we beseech their eradication. May all beings enter the realm of supreme immortals, unite with the Dao, and merge with the Perfected. We bow to the Ten Directions’ Orthodox Three Treasures."*

chunks.original_text: 众等至心归神无极大道天尊，忏悔皇家、及臣众等一切众生，前代今身，或神识所犯，志念不专，情浮意动，驰骋不息。 心业大罪，无量无边，因今礼忏，并乞荡除，皆愿众等，神合真寂，洞入自然，稽首十方正真三宝。 众等至心归命无极大道天尊，忏悔皇家、及臣众等一切众生，或口业所犯，善恶反论，绮言饰非，华词惑众。 口业大罪，无量无边，因今礼忏，并乞荡除，皆愿众等，性命合道，玄会无为，稽首十方正真三宝。 人各平立唱，一礼北向，平立诵经，颂曰： 乐法以为妻，爱经如珠玉。 持戒制六情，念道遣所欲。 淡泊正气停，萧然神静默。 天魔并敬护，世世受大福。 郁郁家国盛，济济经道兴。 天人同其愿，缥缈入大乘。 因心立福田，靡靡法轮升。 七祖生天堂，我身白日腾。 大道洞玄虚，有念无不契。 炼质入仙真，遂成金刚体。 超度三界难，地狱五苦解。 悉归太上经，静念稽首礼。 至心稽首太上无极大道， 至心稽首三十六部尊经，至心稽首玄中大法师。 一愿二仪长久，覆载无穷，至心稽首正真三宝； 二愿日月运行，光明普照，至心稽首正真三宝； 三愿皇家宗庙先灵，神升九天，志心稽首正真三宝； 四愿皇帝圣化无穷，德合二仪，至心稽首正真三宝； 五愿皇储仁孝贞明，绍隆圣绪，至心稽首正真三宝； 六愿诸王兄弟、文武职僚，奉上尽诚，安人用道，至心稽首正真三宝； 七愿天下太平，兵戈止息，至心稽首正真三宝； 八愿师尊父母，亡者生天，见存安乐，至心稽首正真三宝； 九愿众等慧业日新，智灯无尽，至心稽首正真三宝； 十愿十方施主，凡厥有缘，俱舍苦 因，咸登道岸，至心稽首正真三宝； 十一愿法界威灵、金刚力士，用道神通，摄邪归正，至心稽首正真三宝； 十二愿三涂五苦、法界众生，并出欲缠，同升福岸，至心稽首正真三宝。 咏学仙颂 学仙行为急，奉戒制情心。 虚夷正气居，仙圣自相寻。 若不信法言，胡为栖山林。 科曰：凡朝，依此仪。 违，夺算一千二百。 中斋仪 时至澡漱，供养悉如法，唱人各恭敬。 至心稽首太上无极大道，至心稽首三十六部尊经，至心稽首玄中大法师。 行道行香，一切众官诵无上尊，行香。 颂曰： 道以斋为先，勤行登金阙。 故设大法桥，普度诸人物。 宿世恩德报，道心超然发。 身飞升玄都，七祖咸解脱。 至心稽首太上三尊、十方众圣。 斋官长跪，叹道功德。 原夫无色之己，示妙色於人间； 无身之身，见真身於象外。 故能形分百万，变化无穷，影散亿千，随迎莫测。 由是慈周法界，则劫劫度人； 德被尘沙，乃方方教化。 或游行八十一国，化被西戎； 或在世九百余年，导兹中夏。 普使人天悟道二长登解脱之门，生死归真，并出轮回之浪。 然后神凝金阙，独为万圣之宗； 体妙琼都，高步九清之上。 是知天上天下，三界十方，巍巍最尊，惟吾大道。 今日斋官某甲为某事，修营妙供，以荐微诚，归命十方，虔心三宝。 当愿神通自在，俯念众生； 妙应无边，仰垂慈泽。 即使飞天下降，示罪福之科； 妙行齐临，按因缘之格。 尘沙咎累，并乞消除； 浩劫愆尤，皆蒙荡涤。 见在善根增长，共骞树以同年； 过去恶业消亡，等香林之受乐。 凭兹胜福，普暨无穷，九幽绝悲痛｀之魂，六趣罢轮回之识，逮乎凡诸品汇，普是含灵，俱超爱欲之河，并陆逍遥之岸。
chunks.translated_text:
We prostrate with utmost sincerity to the Boundless Great Dao Heavenly Worthy, confessing on behalf of the imperial house, all officials, and all beings. In past lives and the present, our minds may have transgressed—our thoughts and intentions may have lacked focus, emotions drifted, and desires wandered without cease. The sins of mental karma are measureless and boundless. Through this rite of repentance, we beseech their eradication. May all beings unite their spirits with true quiescence, penetrate the natural, and bow to the Ten Directions’ Orthodox Three Treasures.

We prostrate with utmost sincerity to the Boundless Great Dao Heavenly Worthy, confessing on behalf of the imperial house, all officials, and all beings. Our speech may have transgressed—good and evil reversed in discourse, deceitful words embellished falsehoods, and flowery rhetoric deluded the masses. The sins of verbal karma are measureless and boundless. Through this rite of repentance, we beseech their eradication. May all beings unite their nature and life with the Dao, profoundly merge with non-action, and bow to the Ten Directions’ Orthodox Three Treasures.

Each stands upright and chants, then bows facing north. Standing, they recite the scripture, intoning:

*"Delight in the Dharma as one’s wife,
Cherish the scriptures as pearls and jade.
Uphold the precepts to restrain the six senses,
Contemplate the Dao to dispel desires.
Serene and pure, the upright qi abides,
Tranquil and still, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
Lifetimes receive boundless fortune.
Flourishing are the state and family,
Prosperous the scriptures and Dao.
Heaven and humanity share this vow,
Ethereally entering the Great Vehicle.
Cultivating the mind to establish merit,
The Dharma wheel ascends without cease.
Seven ancestors ascend to heavenly halls,
My body soars in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the mysterious void,
Every thought finds perfect accord.
Refining the body to join the immortals,
Attaining the adamantine form.
Transcending the three realms’ trials,
The five sufferings of hell dissolve.
All return to the Supreme Scriptures,
In silent contemplation, we bow in reverence."*

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao,
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures,
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

First vow: May the Two Principles endure eternally, their covering and bearing boundless. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Second vow: May the sun and moon traverse their paths, their radiance illuminating all. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Third vow: May the imperial ancestral spirits ascend to the Nine Heavens. With devoted hearts, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Fourth vow: May the emperor’s sagely transformation be infinite, his virtue harmonizing with the Two Principles. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Fifth vow: May the imperial heir embody benevolence, filial piety, integrity, and wisdom, continuing the sagely lineage. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Sixth vow: May all imperial kinsmen, civil and military officials, serve with utmost sincerity, govern with the Dao, and bring peace to the people. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Seventh vow: May the world know great peace, and weapons of war be stilled. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Eighth vow: May departed teachers and parents ascend to heaven, and the living enjoy peace and happiness. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Ninth vow: May our wisdom and merit daily renew, the lamp of insight never extinguished. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Tenth vow: May all benefactors in the Ten Directions, all those with karmic affinity, forsake the causes of suffering and together ascend the shore of the Dao. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Eleventh vow: May the mighty spirits of the Dharma realm and vajra warriors wield the Dao’s divine power to subdue evil and guide to rectitude. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.
Twelfth vow: May all beings in the three wretched realms and five sufferings escape the bonds of desire and together ascend the shore of fortune. With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Orthodox Three Treasures.

*Hymn on Cultivating Immortality*
*"Cultivating immortality is urgent,
Uphold the precepts to restrain the heart’s passions.
Dwell in emptiness and upright qi,
Immortals and sages naturally seek you.
If you do not trust the Dharma’s words,
Why dwell in the mountains and forests?"*

*Regulations state:* For all court audiences, follow this ritual. Violations deduct 1,200 years from one’s lifespan.

*Midday Purification Rite*
At the appointed hour, bathe and cleanse, make offerings according to the proper method, and chant for all to reverently attend.

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao,
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures,
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

Circumambulate while offering incense, all officials recite the Most Supreme Revered One, and offer incense.

*Intoning:*
*"The Dao takes purification as foremost,
Diligent practice ascends the golden portals.
Thus is the great Dharma bridge established,
Universally delivering all beings.
Repaying the kindness of past lives,
The Dao-heart arises transcendent.
The body soars to the Mysterious Capital,
Seven ancestors all attain liberation."*

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Supreme Three Worthies and the Ten Directions’ multitude of sages.

The officiating official kneels and extols the Dao’s merits and virtues.

*"Consider the self without form,
Yet manifesting wondrous forms in the human realm;
The body without substance,
Yet revealing the true body beyond appearances.
Thus able to divide into a hundred thousand forms,
Transformations without end,
Shadows scattered in countless millions,
Unpredictable in their comings and goings.
Thereby, compassion pervades the Dharma realm,
Age after age delivering beings;
Virtue blankets the dust-like worlds,
Everywhere teaching and transforming.
Sometimes traveling through eighty-one lands,
Spreading transformation among the western barbarians;
Sometimes dwelling in the world for over nine hundred years,
Guiding this central land.
Universally enabling humans and devas to awaken,
Both attaining the gate of liberation,
Life and death returning to truth,
All escaping the waves of rebirth.
Thereafter, the spirit congeals in the golden portals,
Alone becoming the ancestor of myriad sages;
The body wondrous in the jade capital,
Loftily treading above the Nine Purities.
Thus, in heaven above and below,
The three realms and ten directions,
Majestic and most revered,
Is only our Great Dao.
Today, the officiating official so-and-so,
For such-and-such a matter, arranges wondrous offerings,
To present this humble sincerity,
Bowing to the Ten Directions, reverently to the Three Treasures.
May the divine power be free and unhindered,
Stooping to consider all beings;
May the wondrous responses be boundless,
Looking up to bestow compassionate blessings.
Even as flying immortals descend,
Revealing the laws of sin and fortune;
May the assembly of wondrous practices arrive,
Examining the standards of karmic conditions.
Dust-like faults and burdens,
All beseech to be eradicated;
Vast kalpas of transgressions,
All beseech to be cleansed.
Present good roots grow,
Together flourishing like the kalpa tree;
Past evil karma vanishes,
Equal to the fragrant groves’ bliss.
Relying on this supreme merit,
Universally extending without limit,
The nine dark realms’ sorrowful souls,
The six destinies’ rebirth consciousness,
All beings and every kind,
All sentient life,
Together transcend the river of love and desire,
All reach the shore of carefree ease."*

chunks.original_text: 愿斋官七世父母，神生净土，胜报无穷，至心稽首正真三宝； 愿斋官宅舍安宁，阖门和睦，至心稽首正真三宝； 愿斋官子孙昌炽，世出贤明，至心稽首正真三宝； 愿斋官罪累荡除，福慧圆满，至心稽首正真三宝； 愿天下太平，万姓安乐，至心稽首正真三宝； 愿一切众生，兔离诸苦，同入正真，至心稽首得道众圣。 平坐如法，施食咒愿曰：此受食咒。 一切作福田，施食最为先。 见世受快乐，过去得生天。 当来居净土，衣食常自然。 是故今供养，普献於诸天。 食遍，齐拱手咒曰： 香厨妙供，上献天尊，中献真圣，下及众生，普同饱满，福流斋官，如水归海。 食讫，施食忏食曰：上启十方天尊，敬白见前。 大众弟子今日所营斋供，或恐手触不净，衣服不净，器物不净，米麦不净，事事种种，多不如法。 愿三宝弘慈，布施欢喜，残有供具，回施一切。 当愿施者得福，食者无罪。 斋官捻香，供养如法，唱赞咏如法。 为诸来生，作善因缘。 如蒙开悟，仰受圣恩。 次斋官持净施，云布施咒，愿上启十方三宝，一切真圣，斋官某甲为某事，设斋已讫，犹恐功德未圆，更舍净财，回施三宝。 当愿布施已后，七祖生天，见存快乐，世世生生，得福无量。 次唱持念，人各恭敬，至心稽首太上三尊、十方众圣。 愿斋官百福装严，万善归集，至心稽首正真三宝。 以此设斋功德，资被群生，离苦解脱，至心稽首礼得道众圣。 科曰：凡一中斋，依此仪。 违，夺算一千六百。 中会仪 入道户，咒漱、捻香、叩齿，并如行道法。 发炉咒曰： 无上三天玄元始气，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香玉童、传言玉女、五帝直符，各三十六人，出关启此间土地里域真官正神。 今故烧香，愿得太上十方正真妙气，降注臣身中，令所启速达径诣至真无极道前。 称名位 太上灵宝洞玄法师某岳真人某，上启，太上无极大道、至真无上三十六部尊经、玄中大法师、二界官属、一切威灵，今故烧香，愿以是功德，归流某家，九玄七祖，见前人口，乞丐原赦，前生今身，一切所犯，元逆丑恶，兆罪亿过，悉乞除荡。 即愿亡者，上生天堂，衣饭自然，见存灾消祸灭，长居福庆善缘之中，门户清贵，子孙昌炽，世世享祚，万愿从心。 今故烧香，克获感通，径至无极道前。 至心稽首东方无极太上灵宝天尊，十方同。 次南，次西，次北，次东北，次东南，次西南，次西北，次上方，次下方。 诵三契颂。 至心稽首太上无极大道，至心稽首三十六部尊经，至心稽首玄中大法师。 重称名位。 太上洞玄灵宝法师某岳真人某，上启太上无极大道、三十六部尊经、玄中大法师、上相上宰、四司五帝、三界官属、一切真灵，某等今故捻香，愿为某忏谢无量劫来至于今日，生死宿罪重过，或违天犯地，轻慢三宝，杀害众生，骂詈咒诅，嫉妬怪贪，邪淫放荡，愚痴窃盗，口是心非，三业六根，罪愆无量。 因今首谢，并乞消除，愿亡者生天，见存安乐，子孙昌炽，福庆自然。 暨乎天下地上，五苦三涂，咸出幽牢，俱蒙惠润，凡诸有识，并入道场。 谨启，二上香，复炉咒曰：香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令此问朝会之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，集在香火案前。
chunks.translated_text:
May the patrons’ seven generations of parents ascend to the Pure Land, their sublime rewards boundless—with utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures.
May the patrons’ households know peace, their doors harmonious—with utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures.
May the patrons’ descendants flourish, each generation wise and bright—with utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures.
May the patrons’ karmic burdens be washed away, their blessings and wisdom perfected—with utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures.
May the world know great peace, all families joyful—with utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures.
May all beings escape every suffering, together enter the True—with utmost sincerity, we bow to the assembly of enlightened sages.

Seated in proper form, the offering of food is blessed with this prayer:
*"This incantation for receiving food—
All fields of merit find,
In offering food, the foremost deed.
In this life, joy is known;
In past lives, rebirth in heaven gained.
In future times, dwelling in the Pure Land,
Clothing and sustenance ever natural.
Thus we now make offering,
Universally presenting to all deities."*

When the food is distributed, all join hands and recite:
*"Exquisite offerings from the fragrant kitchen,
Presented above to the Heavenly Worthies,
In the middle to the Perfected Sages,
Below to all beings—
Universally sated and fulfilled,
Blessings flow to the patrons,
As waters return to the sea."*

After the meal, the offering of repentance is made:
*"We humbly invoke the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions.
Before this assembly, we declare:
The vegetarian feast prepared today by the disciples
May have been touched by impure hands,
Worn impure garments,
Used impure vessels,
Contained impure grains—
In every matter, many imperfections may have arisen.
May the Three Treasures, in vast compassion,
Bestow joy upon the offering.
Any remaining provisions,
We dedicate universally.
May the givers receive blessings,
And those who partake be free from transgression."*

The patrons then take incense, making offerings according to ritual, chanting and praising as prescribed.
For all future lives, they plant the seeds of good karma.
If enlightenment is granted, they reverently receive the sagely grace.

Next, the patrons present pure offerings, reciting the prayer of dedication:
*"We humbly invoke the Three Treasures of the Ten Directions and all Perfected Sages.
The patrons [Name], having completed this feast for [purpose],
Fearing the merit may yet be incomplete,
Now offer pure wealth, dedicating it to the Three Treasures.
May this act of giving,
Afterward bring the seven ancestors to heaven,
Those living know joy,
And through all future lives,
Receive boundless blessings."*

Then the chanting begins, each person reverently joining:
*"With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Supreme Three Worthies and the assembly of sages of the Ten Directions.
May the patrons be adorned with a hundred blessings,
A myriad virtues gathered—
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the True Three Treasures.
Through this feast’s merit,
May all beings be encompassed,
Freed from suffering, liberated—
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the assembly of enlightened sages."*

**Ritual Instructions:**
For a medium-scale feast, follow this rite.
Those who violate it forfeit 1,600 days of lifespan.

**Medium Assembly Rite**
Entering the Dao’s gate, recite the purification incantation, take incense, and knock the teeth—all as in the *Rite of Walking the Dao*.

The incense-burning incantation:
*"Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Original Qi,
Most High Lord Lao,
Summon forth from within this servant’s body:
The Three and Five Merit Officers,
Left and Right Attendant Envoys,
Jade Lads of Incense,
Jade Maidens of Transmission,
Direct Messengers of the Five Thearchs—
Each thirty-six in number.
Open the passes and invoke the local earth deities and true officials of this realm.
Now we burn incense,
May the wondrous qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions and True Perfected Ones
Descend and infuse this servant’s body,
So that what is declared swiftly reaches
The presence of the Utmost True and Boundless Dao."*

**Declaring Name and Rank:**
*"Most High Numinous Treasure Cavern-Mystery Dharma Master [Name], Perfected One of [Sacred Peak],
Humbly invokes:
The Utmost Boundless Great Dao,
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Supreme Scriptures,
The Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm,
Officials of the Two Realms,
All majestic spirits.
Now we burn incense,
May this merit flow to [Family Name],
Their nine generations of ancestors and seven generations of parents,
Those living and present,
Begging forgiveness and absolution.
For all transgressions—
Past lives and present,
Every offense, rebellion, and foul deed,
Countless sins and myriad faults—
All beseech to be eradicated.
May the deceased ascend to heaven,
Clothed and fed by nature,
Those living see disasters vanish and misfortunes cease,
Ever dwelling in blessings, fortune, and good karma.
May their households be noble and pure,
Descendants flourish,
Generation after generation enjoy prosperity,
All wishes fulfilled.
Now we burn incense,
May resonance swiftly reach
The presence of the Boundless Dao."*

*"With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Eastern Utmost Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy."*
[Repeat for all ten directions: South, West, North, Northeast, Southeast, Southwest, Northwest, Above, Below.]

Recite the Three Pacts and Hymns.

*"With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Utmost Boundless Great Dao.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Supreme Scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm."*

**Re-declaring Name and Rank:**
*"Most High Cavern-Mystery Numinous Treasure Dharma Master [Name], Perfected One of [Sacred Peak],
Humbly invokes:
The Utmost Boundless Great Dao,
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Supreme Scriptures,
The Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm,
High Ministers and High Chancellors,
Officials of the Four Offices and Five Thearchs,
Officials of the Three Realms,
All true spirits.
Now we take incense,
Wishing to repent and atone for
Countless kalpas of transgressions up to this day,
The heavy sins of past lives and deaths—
Whether offending heaven or violating earth,
Disrespecting the Three Treasures,
Killing and harming beings,
Cursing and reviling,
Envy, malice, greed,
Lust, dissipation,
Ignorance, theft,
Duplicity in speech and thought,
The three karmas and six senses—
Innumerable transgressions.
Now we confess and beseech their eradication.
May the deceased ascend to heaven,
Those living know peace,
Descendants flourish,
Blessings arise naturally.
May all on earth and in heaven,
The five sufferings and three paths,
Escape dark prisons,
Together receive grace and nourishment.
May all sentient beings
Enter the Dao’s precincts."*

Respectfully declared.
A second offering of incense, the incantation for sealing the burner:
*"Incense Official Envoys,
Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
Attendant Spirit Officials—
May this place of assembly
Naturally generate golden liquid, cinnabar, azure essence,
Mushroom spirits, a hundred numina,
All Perfected Ones gathered,
Assembled before the incense altar."*

chunks.original_text: 十方仙童玉女，侍卫香烟，传奏臣向来一咸启，径至无极道前。 旋行，颂出。 道以斋为先，勤行登金阙。 故设大法桥，普度诸人物。 宿世恩德报，道心超然发。 身飞升玄都，七祖咸解脱。 科曰：凡中会，依此仪。 违，夺算一千六百。 度人仪 斋时未至，应度人列阶下，西面辞父母，谢九玄，合十二拜。 次北面拜天子，四拜。 所以者，冠带天尊法服，更不复拜父母、国君故也，於此入道之际，须辞谢耳。 既讫，拱手端身，北向三归三宝三礼。 至心归身太上无极大道，至心归神三十六部尊经，至心归命玄中大法师。 回面西礼监度三师，各三拜讫，便长跪。 先保举师为着法裙，次监度师为着云袖，次度师为着法帔。 然后便为戴法冠毕，退礼三师，三拜，北面执简端立，师面东平立，诵智慧三首。 其词曰： 智慧起本无，朗朗超十方。 结空峙玄霄，诸天挹流芳。 其妙难思议，虚感真实通。 有有竟不有，无无无不容。 智慧恒观身，学道之所先。 眇眇入玄津，自然录我神。 天尊常拥护，魔王为保言。 晃晃金刚躯，迢迢太上清。 智慧生戒根，真道戒为主。 三宝由是兴，高圣所崇受。 泛此不死舟，奖欻济大有。 当此说戒时，诸天并稽首。 每至首终，齐唱善礼，一拜总讫，回身礼十方，从北始，至心归命北方无极太上灵宝天尊，十方同。 次东，次南，次西，次东南，次东北，次西南，次西北，次上方，次下方。 次退，居东面西。 师西面东向，为说十戒。 新度人皆称名受。 天尊言：善男子、善女子，能发自然道意，来入法何，受我十戒，则为大道清信弟子，皆与勇猛飞天齐功，於是不退，可得超凌三界，得为上清真人。 汝当伏受，谛听在心。 一者不杀，当念众生；
chunks.translated_text:
Celestial youths and jade maidens of the ten directions,
Attend the incense smoke,
Transmit and memorialize all that has been declared,
Directly to the presence of the Boundless Dao.

Proceed in procession, then recite the hymn:

The Dao holds purification as foremost,
Diligent practice ascends the Golden Gates.
Thus is the great Dharma Bridge established,
Universally ferrying all beings and things.
Repaying karmic kindness from past lives,
The Dao-mind arises transcendent.
The body soars to the Mystic Capital,
Seven generations all attain liberation.

**Protocol states:**
For all central assemblies, follow this rite.
Violation incurs a penalty of one thousand six hundred years from one’s lifespan.

**Rite for Ferrying Beings**
Before the purification hour arrives, those to be ferried stand at the base of the steps, facing west to take leave of parents and give thanks to the nine ancestral generations, performing twelve prostrations in total.
Next, face north to bow to the Son of Heaven, four prostrations.
This is because, having donned the vestments of the Heavenly Worthy, one no longer bows to parents or the sovereign. Yet at this moment of entering the Dao, leave-taking is required.
Once completed, clasp hands and stand upright, facing north to take the Three Refuges and perform three bows to the Three Treasures.
With utmost sincerity, take refuge in the body of the Most High Boundless Great Dao.
With utmost sincerity, take refuge in the spirit of the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, take refuge in the life of the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.
Turn to face west and bow to the Three Masters—Overseer, Ferryman, and Ordainer—each with three prostrations. Then kneel.
First, the Preceptor fastens the Dharma skirt;
Next, the Overseer fastens the cloud sleeves;
Then, the Ordainer fastens the Dharma mantle.
After the Dharma crown is placed upon the head, withdraw and bow three times to the Three Masters.
Stand upright, holding the tablet, facing north.
The Master stands facing east, reciting the Three Hymns of Wisdom:

*Wisdom arises from the originless,
Luminous, transcending the ten directions.
Weaving emptiness, it towers in the Mystic Empyrean,
All heavens draw from its fragrant flow.
Its subtlety defies thought,
Vacuity and resonance truly commune.
Being is ultimately non-being,
Non-being holds all without exclusion.*

*Wisdom ever observes the body,
The foremost study of the Dao.
Subtly entering the Mystic Ford,
Naturally my spirit is recorded.
The Heavenly Worthy ever guards,
The Demon King vows protection.
Resplendent is the vajra body,
Lofty the Most High Clarity.*

*Wisdom engenders the root of precepts,
The true Dao holds precepts as master.
From this the Three Treasures arise,
Revered and received by exalted sages.
Riding this deathless vessel,
Swiftly it ferries the great multitude.
At this moment of precept-recitation,
All heavens together bow their heads.*

At the beginning and end of each hymn, all chant *"Excellent!"* and bow once. After all are completed, turn to bow to the ten directions, beginning with the north:
With utmost sincerity, take refuge in the life of the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless North.
(Repeat for all ten directions: east, south, west, southeast, northeast, southwest, northwest, above, and below.)
Then withdraw, standing in the east facing west.
The Master stands in the west facing east, expounding the Ten Precepts.
The newly ferried all recite their names to receive them.

The Heavenly Worthy declares:
*"Good men and good women, you who have aroused the natural Dao-mind and come to enter the Dharma—receive my Ten Precepts, and you shall become pure and faithful disciples of the Great Dao. Together with the valiant flying immortals, you shall share equal merit. Thus unwavering, you may transcend the Three Realms and become Perfected Ones of the Highest Clarity. Submit and receive them, heed them deeply in your hearts."*

*First: Do not kill. Contemplate all living beings.*

chunks.original_text: 二者不淫，妄行邪念； 三者不盗，取非义财； 四者不欺，善恶，反论； 五者不醉，常思净行； 六者宗亲和睦，无有非亲； 七者见人善事，心助欢喜； 八者见人有忧，助为作福； 九者彼来加我，志在不报； 十者付切未得道，我不有望。 天尊言：修奉清戒，每合天心，常行大慈，愿为一切，慊慊尊教，不敢中 怠，宁守善而死，不为恶而生，於此不退，可得拔度五道，不履三恶，长斋奉戒，自得度世。 新度人礼师三拜，北向礼三尊三拜。 诵奉戒颂，其词曰： 道为无心宗，一切作福田。 立功无定主，本愿各由人。 虚己应众生，注心莫不均。 大圣弘至教，亦由雨降天。 高陵靡不周，常卑故成渊。 海为百川王，是能合龙鳞。 万劫保智用，岂但在厥年。 奉戒不暂亏，世世善结缘。 精思念大乘，会当体道真。 科曰：凡度人，依此仪。 违，夺算一千二百。 科曰：凡八仪，道士、女冠，行事所要，指擿时须，集成此卷，当依而奉之。 违，四司考魂，不复名上道科，夺算二千四百。 洞玄灵宝三洞奉道科戒营始卷之六竟
chunks.translated_text:
Second: Do not engage in licentiousness or entertain wayward and deviant thoughts.
Third: Do not steal or take wealth that is not rightfully yours.
Fourth: Do not deceive; reverse false judgments of good and evil.
Fifth: Do not become intoxicated; constantly reflect on pure conduct.
Sixth: Maintain harmony among clan and kin, without fostering enmity.
Seventh: Upon seeing others do good deeds, rejoice and lend your heart’s support.
Eighth: Upon seeing others in distress, assist them in performing meritorious acts.
Ninth: When others inflict harm upon you, resolve not to seek repayment.
Tenth: Before achieving the Dao yourself, do not harbor expectations of others.

The Heavenly Worthy declares:
*"Those who cultivate and uphold these pure precepts align ever with the heart of Heaven. Ever practicing great compassion, they aspire to act for the sake of all. Reverently following the exalted teachings without negligence, they would rather die in adherence to goodness than live by doing evil. Unwavering in this, they may transcend the Five Paths and avoid the Three Evil Realms. By maintaining a perpetual fast and upholding the precepts, they shall naturally attain deliverance across the world."*

The newly ferried bow three times to the Master, then turn north and bow three times to the Three Worthies.

They recite the Precept Hymn, which says:
*The Dao is the宗 of non-action,
All things become fields of merit.
Establishing merit has no fixed master,
Each person’s original vow is their own.
Emptying the self to respond to all beings,
Direct the mind without partiality.
The Great Sage expounds the utmost teaching,
As rain descends from Heaven.
Lofty heights reach all without exception,
Yet the humble become profound.
The sea is king of a hundred rivers,
Thus it gathers the scales of dragons.
Through ten thousand kalpas, wisdom is preserved,
Not merely for the span of years.
Upholding the precepts without the slightest lapse,
Lifetimes of good karmic bonds are formed.
With focused thought, contemplate the Great Vehicle,
And you shall embody the true Dao."*

The statute states: *"All who ferry others across must follow this ritual."*

Those who violate this shall have their allotted years reduced by one thousand two hundred.

The statute states: *"These Eight Rituals are the essentials for Daoist priests and nuns in their practice. Compiled for timely reference, they must be observed accordingly."*

Those who violate this shall be examined by the Four Offices, their souls no longer counted among the statutes of the Supreme Dao, and their allotted years reduced by two thousand four hundred.

*Here ends Scroll Six of the* Dongxuan Lingbao Sandong Fengdao Kejie Yingshi.

enly Worthy declares:
*"Good men and good women, you who have aroused the natural Dao-mind and come to enter the Dharma—receive my Ten Precepts, and you shall become pure and faithful disciples of the Great Dao. Together with the valiant flying immortals, you shall share equal merit. Thus unwavering, you may transcend the Three Realms and become Perfected Ones of the Highest Clarity. Submit and receive them, heed them deeply in your hearts."*

*First: Do not kill. Contemplate all living beings.*
